meta.description:
The layer shows the risk category across Italy, based on flood depth (m) expected for a 10-year return period, meaning there is a 10% chance of exceeding a predefined flood level in any given year.
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/Europe_RP10_filled_depth_reclassified_reprojected.tif

attribution.text: River Flood Hazard Maps at European and Global Scale

meta.description:
The layer shows the risk category  across Italy, based on flood depth (m) expected for a 500-year return period, meaning there is a 0.2% chance of exceeding a predefined flood level in any given year.

layout.interfaceGroup: Flood Exposure: Return Period Analysis

meta.description:
The layer shows the flood risk category across Italy, determined by the frequency (%) of the intersecting pixels detected as flooded across all 5-day composite VIIRS images from Jan 2012 to Dec 2024, reflecting how often those pixels appeared flooded compared to the total number of images.
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/Final_FREQ_Reclassified_reprojected.tif

attribution.text: NOAA Satellite Proving Ground Global Flood Products Archive

layout.interfaceGroup: Flood Hazard Map - Frequency Analysis for Entire Italy

meta.description:
The layer shows the flood risk category across Italy, determined by the frequency (%) of the intersecting pixels detected as flooded across all 5-day composite VIIRS images from Jan 2012 to Dec 2024 and Sentinel-1 imagery, reflecting how often those pixels appeared flooded compared to the total number of images.
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/Combined_Reclassified_reprojected.tif

attribution.text: NOAA Satellite Proving Ground Global Flood Products Archive & Copernicus Sentinel-1

layout.interfaceGroup: Flood Hazard Map - Frequency Analysis for Po Basin

sources.name: Risk of Number of precipitation days exceeding 20 mm - 90th Percentile (1950-2019)

meta.description:
The layer shows the extreme rainfall risk category across Italy, based on the 90th percentile of the number of days per year when the daily rainfall amount exceeded 20mm using rainfall data from 1950 to 2019. In simple terms, it highlights areas at risk of experiencing frequent heavy rainfall days each year.
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/Dilation_NB_no_days_gt_20mm_90th_1950-2019_classes_EPSG3857.tif

attribution.text: Extreme precipitation risk indicators for Europe and European cities from 1950 to 2019. This dataset was produced on behalf of the Copernicus Climate Change Service.

layout.interfaceGroup: Extreme Rainfall Risk Map - Frequency of High Daily Rainfall Events - Percentile Analysis

meta.description:
The layer represents land subsidence risk categories in areas with slopes less than 10% across Sicily, Italy. The analysis is based on ground motion velocity data provided by the European Ground Motion Service (EGMS).
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/risk_subsidence_lower0_veloc_reclas.tif

attribution.text: EGMS

layout.interfaceGroup: Ground Movement Risk Map - Sicily

meta.description:
The layer represents landslides risk categories in areas with slopes more than 10% across Sicily, Italy. The analysis is based on ground motion velocity data provided by the European Ground Motion Service (EGMS).
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/risk_landslides_lower0_veloc_reclas.tif

attribution.text: EGMS

layout.interfaceGroup: Ground Movement Risk Map - Sicily

sources.name: Land Subsidence Risk Map - Sicily (Small Region 1)

meta.description:
The layer represents land subsidence risk categories in areas with slopes less than 10% across small region (Region-1) in Sicily, Italy. The analysis is based on ground velocity and displacement time series derived from InSAR processing of six years of Sentinel-1 data specifically over this area.
Download: https://storage.googleapis.com/eo_best_practices_2023/EOtransportation/velocity_3857_pb1_slope_le10_reclas.tiff

attribution.text: Copernicus Sentinel-1
